content.raw:
This is not something that we’ve tested with VRX and not something that I’m personally familiar with beyond the explanation here: [http://gazebosim.org/tutorials/?tut=ros\_comm#Services:Stateandpropertysetters](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials/?tut=ros_comm#Services:Stateandpropertysetters)

I tried this running the following:

Check the properties:

```
rosservice call /gazebo/get_link_properties "link_name: 'wamv::base_link'" 
com: 
  position: 
    x: -0.006884
    y: -0.000962
    z: 0.259365
  orientation: 
    x: 0.0
    y: 0.0
    z: 0.0
    w: 1.0
gravity_mode: True
mass: 251.185
ixx: 226.265
ixy: 0.122433
ixz: 1.87275
iyy: 455.948
iyz: 0.291158
izz: 500.477
success: True
status_message: "GetLinkProperties: got properties"
```

The set the properties

```
rosservice call /gazebo/set_link_properties "link_name: 'wamv::base_link'
com:
  position: {x: 0.0, y: 0.0, z: 0.0}
  orientation: {x: 0.0, y: 0.0, z: 0.0, w: 0.0}
gravity_mode: false
mass: 0.0
ixx: 0.0
ixy: 0.0
ixz: 0.0
iyy: 0.0
iyz: 0.0
izz: 0.0" 
```

Rechecking using `rosservice call /gazebo/get_link_properties "link_name: 'wamv::base_link'"` suggests that the parameters have changed. 

The position and gravity parameters seem to have roughly the anticipated effect.  Changing the mass doesn’t seem to how the WAM-V floats - I would have expected that to change. 

If it is a feature you need for non-VRX tasks, you might try running a model without the dynamics plugin to see if there is an issue with the VRX plugin or an issue within Gazebo.
